title: Knowsley Hall Park Walks

images.title: John Stead / Knowsley Trigpoint and "The Stand"
images.caption: Knowsley Trigpoint and "The Stand"

images.title: John Stead / The White Man, Knowsley Park
images.caption: The White Man, Knowsley Park. The White Man stands on the highest ground in Knowsley Park the seat of the Earls of Derby and gave its name to the nearby White Man's Dam. The view includes in the distance Billinge Hill and to the right the edge of Knowsley Safari Park.

description: Knowsley Hall is a grand stately home located in Merseyside. The hall has a rich history, tracing its origins back to 1495. Nestled within a vast 2,500-acre private walled estate, it proudly serves as the ancestral residence of The Earl and Countess of Derby. While maintaining its private character, Knowsley Hall opens its doors to the public for a designated week each year, offering guided tours. During these tours, visitors have the opportunity to delve into the opulent interiors, adorned with exquisite details, and unravel the fascinating history that intertwines with Knowsley Hall and the distinguished line of the Earls of Derby. It provides an exclusive glimpse into the heritage and grandeur of this historic estate. The historic hall is also surrounded by some lovely gardens and grounds including lakes and a safari park where you can enjoy some fine walking trails.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Just to the west there's the splendid Croxteth Country Park to visit. There's a fine old hall surrounded by 500 acres of woodland and parkland to enjoy here. For more walking ideas in the area see the Merseyside Walks page.

display_address: Knowsley Hall, Dark Entry, Knowsley, Liverpool City Region, England, L34 4AE, United Kingdom
